issues.title: Option name
issues.author: chrysn
issues.body:
MCR [on list](https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/core/8JQplbquf6gBp1lDmpSZId4eGlI):

* Uri-Short-Path for consistency with other options?

comments.author: mguetschow
comments.body: Or `Uri-Path-Short` to better express the grouping (and mutual exclusion) with `Uri-Path`?

comments.author: chrysn
comments.body:
Interim narrowed to Uri-Path-XXX where XXX could be "Short", but people associate short paths with routing. So, in decreasing order of my preference, more suggestions for -02:

* Uri-Path-Registered
* Uri-Path-Well-Known
* Uri-Path-Registered
* Uri-Path-Compact
* Uri-Path-Concise
* Uri-Path-Constrained
* Uri-Path-Tiny
* Q-Uri-Path
* Uri-Pth

issues.title: Link to .well-known/ registry?
issues.author: chrysn
issues.body:
Strictly speaking our new registry is decoupled from the .well-known registry, but IIRC there was precedent for placing notes in registries if they become foreign keys of others, so maybe that's possible here even when it's not *exclusively* a foreign key.

See-Also: https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/core/8JQplbquf6gBp1lDmpSZId4eGlI

issues.title: Allow Uri-Path prefixes?
issues.author: chrysn
issues.body:
For some potential use cases it may make sense for users to have Uri-Path prefixes.

## Example

If IPSO smart objects had used this (say, with Short-Uri-Path 127 expanding to nothing but followed by an option value that's a CBOR sequence of integers to be expanded into decimal ASCII path segments:

```
Short-Uri-Path: (decimal) 127
Short-Uri-Path: (CBORseq) 3, 0, 2, 12, 42
```

equivalent to

```
Uri-Path: (text) 3
Uri-Path: (text) 0
...
```

then, given how LwM2M now allows some of it to be hosted under a prefix resource such as `/wherever/3/0/2/12/42`, it'd make perfect sense to express that with an Uri-Path option followed by Short-Uri-Path

## The challenge

… is to express this in a document without saying that it's a good idea to do it (it's not a bad idea either, but nothing *typical*), and in such a way that it is clear that unless someone actively uses that construction (e.g. they run such an IPSO server *and* chose in that very server implementation to allow a prefix), they don't need any special implementation of it, and the code they'd write if it were not for the section still satisfies all requirements?

## The question

* Is there any other reason not to allow it?
* Can we come up with text that solves the challenge and is otherwise super compact?

comments.author: chrysn
comments.body: Thanks for the fixes. We've been working in parallel, and one has been addressed in 77f6c6f6ea64430a1827d766d867e51ffde95d7b.

reviews.author: mguetschow
reviews.body: I do prefer this name as already mentioned in https://github.com/chrysn/shopinc/issues/1#issuecomment-3113394577

pulls.title: Subsequent options
pulls.author: mcr
pulls.body:
(ignore first two commits, they are in other PRs, but can not change base when out-of-org)
added more details about subsequent options.

comments.author: chrysn
comments.body:
As there've been editing conflicts from me not pushing everything right away, I'm cherry-picking here a little:
* "split this important statement into new paragraph": f0315983cec04d966402d1466191577b0551b4a4 became 6efd561a346155cd56ba67f500a161617cdfae0e
* "question: do we need to say more about proxies": Answered in https://github.com/chrysn/shopinc/pull/7
* Registering the EST/BRSKI paths is pulled out because it conflicted with the switch to uint values, now in https://github.com/chrysn/shopinc/pull/8

What remains is applying #4, and ae804762fa177afe3087b90e11990db2a4d76100 (explicitly naming the rules), which there are open points on (roughly "how to best recurse" and "is forbidden a sensible choice", and "remove the previous examples-of-rules, maybe even unifying the rules in one place only").

I suggest we talk about them in the upcoming interim, and then apply the rest of this PR (probably by copy-pasting due to the edit conflicts) considering whatever we find during the interim.

"comes in two forms" not good.

➔ 

The option value of the first U-P-S Option controls whether further U-P-S Options are allowed and how they are interpreted.

```suggestion
* all initial options contain an opaque sequence of bytes, exactly like {{!RFC7252, Section 3.2}}'s opaque encoding.
```
We don't have to say anything here if we don't know what we want to say.  Except that the meaning and possible values are controlled by the first U-P-S option.

```suggestion
The option value of the first U-P-S Option controls whether further U-P-S Options are allowed and how they are interpreted.
```
Does each UPS option control what happens after it, if it's not a string?

```suggestion
Whether subsequent options contain a uint or a string is determined by the definition of the option in the {{registry}}.
```

Chaining directly into this registry doesn't make sense for many values (`/.well-known/brski/.well-known/edhoc`?), and also doesn't need the CBOR escape hatch of not having the MSB set. I'd rather have those documents specify their own list, either hardcoded in their specification or using a registry mechanism available to them.

Thata'd be MUST NOT send and MUST ignore, which is practically unusable if one decides otherwise later. ("Practically", because those options could give hints, but Uri-Path-ish are not typically used in a hinting fashion).

In 9b60ac087f2259700e19d88f8f75ce8ca932867f I rather suggest going with unspecified or plain initial+path; as an implementer I don't think that's harder to do (as the options are critical and thus need to be processed anyway).

With the new text, the whole "examples of rules" can go out; let's have one or two places only to list them (currently it's two, the text in the option description and the choices for IANA, but I'd prefer to unify them.)

pulls.title: Proxy statement
pulls.author: chrysn
pulls.body:
Recommend that proxies pass on unknown values
    
This picks up a point by @mcr from https://github.com/chrysn/shopinc/pull/6: "what does a CoAP/HTTP proxy do if it sees Uri-Path-Short options for which it does not have knowledge?"

Another commit completes a sentence; this is bycatch from processing where that question would have been inserted.

pulls.title: Add /.w-k/brski and /.w-k/est
pulls.author: chrysn
pulls.body:
Based on https://github.com/chrysn/shopinc/pull/6

This does not pick up other parts of that issue due to editing conflicts; the text after this PR is a bit under-specified because so far adding repeated options is just an example, and suddenly we rely on that behavior, but that'll be cleaned up applying the rest of #6.
